item.title: She Has a Choice Now
item.description: Bishops serve and care for those who are in their ward boundaries, including those who are not members of the Church.

item.title: Happy to Serve
item.description: Church-service missionaries serve in the bishops' storehouse.

item.title: Jerry Foote Family
item.description: Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints contribute fast offerings to provide for the welfare of people of all faiths in their times of need.

item.title: Los Angeles Volunteers
item.description: A bishop tells about his responsibility to oversee the needs of the ward, giving assistance to families in need. Those families in turn volunteer at welfare facilities, including the storehouse, vineyard, and cannery.

item.title: Deseret Industries Awareness
item.description: The DI Awareness video is designed to help community planning groups and city councils understand what having a DI in their community will be like, from the physical appearance to the services they provide.

item.title: DI Donations
item.description: At DI, donations assist people in need throughout the world and help fund training for those who struggle to find jobs.

item.title: Community Partnership Programs
item.description: Deseret Industries partners with non-profit agencies such as schools and shelters to help many people receive donations.

item.title: Deseret Industries Success Portrait: Steve Arrowsmith
item.description: The story of Steve Arrowsmith and how Deseret Industries helped him become a job coach after he had lost everything.

item.title: Deseret Industries Success Portrait: Marcie Shaver
item.description: The story of Marcie Shaver and how Deseret Industries helped her gain perspective and guidance.

item.title: Deseret Industries Success Portrait: Valentina Transtrum
item.description: The story of Valentina Transtrum and how Deseret Industries helped her overcome abuse and gain confidence.

item.title: Deseret Industries Success Portrait: Chris Gardner
item.description: The story of Chris Gardner and how Deseret Industries helped him recognize his potential to overcome challenges.

item.title: Valenzuela Family
item.description: When Carlos and his family came to the United States from Peru, DI helped him pay for a training program to start a career.

item.title: Johnny's Story
item.description: Deseret Industries, a branch of the Church welfare program, provides training and placement to those who struggle to find jobs or acquire employable skills.

item.title: Earl Smith
item.description: Earl fell on hard times when he ran out of work as a general contractor. DI helped him begin a career in the medical field.

item.title: A New Light About Him
item.description: Deseret Industries, a branch of the Church welfare program, provides mentoring and coaching to those who struggle to find meaningful employment.

item.title: Kristel Ramirez
item.description: Through Deseret Industries, Kristel was able to learn English, receive her GED, and become a certified nursing assistant.

item.title: DI Helps People Discover Opportunities
item.description: DI helps people find where their strengths and weaknesses are and helps guide them in directions they may not have considered before.

item.title: DI Helps People Gain Happiness
item.description: DI helps people who have lost their jobs by giving them opportunities to succeed.

item.title: DI Helps People Develop Spiritually
item.description: DI helps people with their spiritual development.

item.title: DI Helps People Realize Their True Passion
item.description: DI helps their associates go after their true passions.

item.title: DI Helps People Develop Interpersonal Skills
item.description: DI helps an immigrant from Russia overcome her inhibitions.

item.title: DI Helps People Progress In Their Education
item.description: DI helps a young man to improve his knowledge and skills to pass his GED.

item.title: DI Helps People Overcome Personal Trials
item.description: DI helps a woman recognize her abilities and overcome anxieties.

item.title: DI Helps People Progress In Their Work Life
item.description: DI helps people overcome personal challenges and find the job they are looking for.

item.title: DI Helps People Become Qualified for Jobs in America
item.description: DI helps people get jobs in America through their partnerships.

item.title: DI Helps People Develop Values and Discover Who They Truly Are
item.description: DI helps people recognize who they really are and what they stand for.

item.title: DI Helps People Reach Their Goals
item.description: DI helped a single mom reach her goal to become a personal trainer.

item.title: DI Helps People Overcome Personal Barriers and Fears
item.description: DI helps a young man overcome shyness and insecurities.

item.title: DI Helps People Find Jobs Through Business Partnerships
item.description: DI helps a young woman find a job she is passionate about through a business partnership.

item.title: DI Helps People Find Their Desired Career
item.description: DI helps associates by providing guidance and support to help them find a profession.

item.title: DI Helps People Realize and Achieve Their Potential
item.description: DI helped a man put his past behind him and get his life back together.

item.title: DI Helps People with Rehabilitation Through a People-Centered Environment
item.description: DI does more than offer customers a thrift store; it helps individuals overcome personal challenges.

item.title: DI Helps Pre-Missionaries and Returned Missionaries
item.description: DI helps people who are preparing to go on a mission and those who just returned from one.

item.title: DI Supports People and Helps Them Move Forward
item.description: DI helps people realize that change is possible.

item.title: Fasting: Philippines Widow
item.description: A widow in the Philippines shows great faith while fasting and donating a fast offering. To learn more, go to Fasting.lds.org

item.title: Fasting: Romania, Paun Family
item.description: A father in Romania teaches his daughter about the importance of fasting and donating a generous fast offering, even when you don't have much. To learn more, go to Fasting.lds.org

item.title: Fasting: Young Single Adult Ward, Amanda
item.description: Amanda, a young single adult attending a YSA ward in Los Angeles, talks about how fasting plays a part in her life. To learn more, go to Fasting.lds.org

item.title: Fasting: Simi Valley Widow
item.description: A California widow explains how fast offerings helped her in a time of need—and how important it is that she donates a generous fast offering now. To learn more, go to Fasting.lds.org

item.title: Fast Offerings: A Simple Commandment with a Marvelous Promise
item.description: Excerpt from President Henry B. Erying’s talk “Is Not This the Fast That I Have Chosen?” He discusses the blessings of the fast and the story of a humble woman who pays a generous fast offering.

item.title: Fast Offerings - The Jerry Foote Family
item.description: A short clip from the Jerry Foote Family video showing the benefits of the fast offering and how it can help those who are in need.

item.title: Jerry Foote Family
item.description: Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints contribute fast offerings to provide for the welfare of people of all faiths in their times of need.

item.title: Welfare Facilities - Home Storage Center
item.description: Food storage can help in times of trouble. To assist in building food storage, the LDS Church has 100 home storage centers throughout the United States and Canada. The Church also has an online store that allows anyone to purchase food storage items.

item.title: Family Home Storage – Meet Jean
item.description: Jean shares her story about how she discovered the blessings of food storage. When her husband lost his job, their preparation helped them live off of what they had saved and stored.

item.title: Family Home Storage – Meet Maureen
item.description: Maureen discusses how she uses her food storage regularly in the family diet and the peace that comes from following the Prophet's inspired counsel to be prepared.

category.title: From Crop to Shelf : Behind the Scenes of Welfare
category.subtitle: Videos: 8

item.title: Deseret Transportation
item.description: Deseret Transportation delivers goods to those in need.

item.title: Deseret Dairy
item.description: A team manager at the Elberta dairy explains the process of producing dairy products. He emphasizes the blessing the products are to families in need and expresses the testimony he has gained by helping others.

item.title: Idaho Falls Welfare Community Gardens
item.description: A community garden in Idaho sponsored by Church members provides food for those in need. The welfare farm opened up remnants of the field to members of other faiths to be used as private gardens.

item.title: Deseret Bakery
item.description: Bakery volunteers tell how they are blessed to help those in need. After the bread is ready, that evening trucks take the bread throughout the western United States—not to sell, but to give to those in need.

item.title: Houston Corporate Partnerships
item.description: Through a partnership between the Church, the Houston Food Bank, and various corporations, the Church helps supply food to the poor of Houston.

item.title: Helping Houston's Hungry
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, the Houston Food Bank, and corporate volunteers have partnered to bring about the Peanut Butter Project. To date, over 700,000 jars of peanut butter have been donated to the Houston Food Bank.

item.title: The Labor of His Hands
item.description: Church members around the world volunteer both time and money to serve others-- members and nonmembers alike--as Christ would serve.

item.title: Thanks Be to God
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints produces hundreds of millions of pounds of food on Church-owned welfare farms. This food is harvested, processed, and distributed through volunteer labor and then given to the poor and needy.

item.title: Be the Someone
item.description: A refugee's life is changed by the volunteers and friends who helped her adapt to a new environment.

item.title: Able to Serve
item.description: Elder Olson talks about his experiences serving as a young Church-service missionary.

item.title: They Gave Up Their Christmas
item.description: Just as the wise men of old gave the Christ child gifts, members of a congregation in California offer service in a vineyard on Christmas day.

item.title: Pepe’s Garden
item.description: Pepe had a large empty field that she could no longer care for. The ward came in and turned the field into a community garden where neighbors— members and nonmembers alike—work together to plant, tend, and harvest crops.

item.title: Idaho Falls Welfare Community Gardens
item.description: A community garden in Idaho sponsored by Church members provides food for those in need. The welfare farm opened up remnants of the field to members of other faiths to be used as private gardens.

item.title: Los Angeles Volunteers
item.description: A bishop tells about his responsibility to oversee the needs of the ward, giving assistance to families in need. Those families in turn volunteer at welfare facilities, including the storehouse, vineyard, and cannery.

item.title: Madera Vineyard Relief Society
item.description: Sisters volunteering at the Madera vineyard explain Relief Society's mission to serve.

item.title: Houston Corporate Partnerships
item.description: Through a partnership between the Church, the Houston Food Bank, and various corporations, the Church helps supply food to the poor of Houston.

item.title: A Time and a Season
item.description: Church-service missionaries serve in the addiction recovery program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Happy to Serve
item.description: Church-service missionaries serve in the bishops' storehouse.

item.title: Madera Volunteers
item.description: Each year, volunteers from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints harvest over 300,000 pounds of raisins from the Madera vineyard. These raisins are donated to the poor and needy all over the world.

item.title: The Labor of His Hands
item.description: Church members around the world volunteer both time and money to serve others-- members and nonmembers alike--as Christ would serve.

item.title: Michelle's Story
item.description: Local Church leaders and members strive to help the poor and needy and follow the admonition of James to "visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction" (James 1:27).

item.title: Helping Houston's Hungry
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, the Houston Food Bank, and corporate volunteers have partnered to bring about the Peanut Butter Project. To date, over 700,000 jars of peanut butter have been donated to the Houston Food Bank.

item.title: Melissa’s Ramp
item.description: Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints seek opportunities to serve their fellowmen in their wards, communities, and beyond.

item.title: The Miracle of The Roof
item.description: A group of 11 men from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints assist a man by restoring his roof.

item.title: Emergency Response Volunteer Training
item.description: Wards and stakes may organize volunteers to assist in the community following a disaster. All volunteers should adhere to Church safety guidelines for disaster cleanup.

item.title: Welfare Overview
item.description: This video gives you an overview of the Welfare program and how it helps those in need all over the world.
